questions.explanation:
Power Girl.

	Power Girl is a survivor of Earth-Two, just like Kal-L and his wife, Lois Lane. Kal-L, his world's Superman, believes that Earth-Two was perfect and sought to restore it, replacing Earth-One.

Superboy-Prime.

	The Watchtower was destroyed at the end of the "Crsis of Conscience" storyline, although nobody knew it was Superboy-Prime's doing at the time. Superboy-Prime is eventually defeated by the two Supermen.

questions.text: Conner Kent dies after fighting Alexander Luthor.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Kent dies after fighting Superboy-Prime. He draws his last breath in the arms of his girlfriend Cassandra Sandsmark, also known as Wonder Girl.

questions.text: A team led by Batman destroys Brother Eye. Who was not on the team?
questions.explanation:
Wonder Woman.

	Brother Eye was a satellite that was tied to the activity of the OMAC's, cyborgs who targeted superpowered beings. Jaime Reyes, the third Blue Beetle, was instrumental in the operation.

Joker.

	The Joker was angry at being left out of the Society of Super-Villains, and took his anger out on Alexander Luthor as Lex Luthor happily looked on.

questions.text: Where do Kal-L and Kal-El defeat Superboy-Prime?
questions.explanation:
Mogo.

	Mogo is a sentient planet and a member of the Green Lantern Corps. After being knocked out by Kal-El, Superboy-Prime is imprisoned on Oa, with fifty Green Lanterns guarding him.

questions.text: When Superboy-Prime seeks to destroy Oa, how many Green Lanterns does he kill?
questions.explanation:
32.

	A total of thirty-two Green Lanterns were killed by a crazed Superboy-Prime when he tried to destroy Oa, the homeworld of the Guardians, who created and oversee the Green Lantern Corps.

questions.text: Alexander Luthor builds a tower using the remains of which villain?
questions.explanation:
The Anti-Monitor.

	The Anti-Monitor was the primary villain for "Crisis on Infinite Earths" and was defeated by a number of super-powered beings, with Kal-L delivering the final blow.

questions.text: Who is offered a place alongside Alexander Luthor, Superboy-Prime and Kal-L?
questions.explanation:
Batman.

	Soon after their escape from the pocket dimension in which they had lived since the events of "Crisis on Infinite Earths", Kal-L claims that Earth-One was responsible for Batman's mistrust and progressive alienation from the rest of the superhero community.

Superboy-Prime.

	Kal-L, the Superman of Earth-Two, joins Kal-El, the Superman of Earth-One, in fighting Superboy-Prime. After dragging him through a field of kryptonite that weakens all three fighters, the two Supermen work together and Kal-El is finally able to knock Superboy-Prime out.
